This request is a natural consequence of Egypt's long-standing policy of seeking the restitution of all archaeological and historical artefacts that have been taken illicitly out of the country, it said. Zahi Hawass has campaigned to repatriate several pharaonic treasures in recent years, including the Rosetta Stone now in the British Museum. The three didn't always agree, particularly when it came to coping with rules in China that require Web-search providers to censor results that government officials deem inappropriate.
